static const int32_t MOVE_TASK_WITH_HOME = 0x00000001
 Flag for moveTaskToFront(int, int): also move the "home" activity along with the task, so it is positioned immediately behind the task.
static const int32_t MOVE_TASK_NO_USER_ACTION = 0x00000002
 Flag for moveTaskToFront(int, int): don't count this as a user-instigated action, so the current activity will not receive a hint that the user is leaving.

ActivityManagerProxy * mpAMProxy

Detailed Description

Interact with the overall pages running in the system. 

 MyPage::onInit(Persistence* const p){
     Context* context = new Context(this);
     PageManager* pageManager = new PageManager(context);
     bool bIsMonkey = pageManager->isUserAMonkey();
     GLOGD("isUserAMonkey = %s", bIsMonkey ? "true" : "false");
     RecentTaskInfoArray* pRecentTasks = pageManager->getRecentTasks(5,
             PageManager::RECENT_WITH_EXCLUDED);
 }

memInfoSystem memory info.
ProcessErrorStateInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getProcessesInErrorState ( )

Returns a list of any processes that are currently in an error condition.

The result will be null if all processes are running properly at this time.

Returns:
Returns a list of ProcessErrorStateInfo records, or null if there are no current error conditions (it will not return an empty list). This list ordering is not specified.
static int32_t gaia::core::PageManager::getProcessPss ( int32_t  pid) [static]

Returns the process' PSS size.

RecentTaskInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getRecentTasks ( int32_t  maxNum,
int32_t  flags 
)

Return a list of the tasks that the user has recently launched, with the most recent being first and older ones after in order.

Parameters:
maxNumThe maximum number of entries to return in the list. The actual number returned may be smaller, depending on how many tasks the user has started and the maximum number the system can remember.
flagsInformation about what to return. May be any combination of enumRecent.
Returns:
Returns a list of RecentTaskInfo records describing each of the recent tasks.
RunningAppProcessInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getRunningAppProcesses ( )

Returns a list of application processes that are running on the device.

Returns:
Returns a list of RunningAppProcessInfo records, or null if there are no running processes (it will not return an empty list). This list ordering is not specified.
RunningDelegationInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getRunningDelegations ( int32_t  maxNum)

Return a list of the deleation that are currently running.

Parameters:
maxNumThe maximum number of entries to return in the list. The actual number returned may be smaller, depending on how many delegation are running.
Returns:
Returns a list of RunningDelegationInfo records describing each of the running tasks.
ApplicationInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getRunningExternalApplications ( ) [private]

Returns a list of application processes installed on external media that are running on the device.

Returns:
Returns a list of ApplicationInfo records, or null if none This list ordering is not specified.
RunningTaskInfoArray gaia::core::PageManager::getRunningTasks ( int32_t  maxNum)

Return a list of the tasks that are currently running, with the most recent being first and older ones after in order.

Note that "running" does not mean any of the task's code is currently loaded or activity -- the task may have been frozen by the system, so that it can be restarted in its previous state when next brought to the foreground.

Parameters:
maxNumThe maximum number of entries to return in the list. The actual number returned may be smaller, depending on how many tasks the user has started.
Returns:
Returns a list of RunningTaskInfo records describing each of the running tasks.
TaskThumbnails gaia::core::PageManager::getTaskThumbnails ( int32_t  id)

Get thumbnails of tasks.

Parameters:
idIdentifier of the target task.
Returns:
static bool gaia::core::PageManager::isUserAMonkey ( ) [static]

Returns "true" if the user interface is currently being messed with by a monkey.

void gaia::core::PageManager::killBackgroundProcesses ( const gaia::base::String &  packageName)

Have the system immediately kill all background processes associated with the given package.

This is the same as the kernel killing those processes to reclaim memory; the system will take care of restarting these processes in the future as needed.

You must hold the permission KILL_BACKGROUND_PROCESSES to be able to call this method.

Parameters:
packageNameThe name of the package whose processes are to be killed.
void gaia::core::PageManager::moveTaskToFront ( int32_t  taskId,
int32_t  flags 
)

Ask that the task associated with a given task ID be moved to the front of the stack, so it is now visible to the user.

Requires that the caller hold permission android.Manifest.permission#REORDER_TASKS or a SecurityException will be thrown.

Parameters:
taskIdThe identifier of the task to be moved, as found in RunningTaskInfo or RecentTaskInfo.
flagsAdditional operational flags, 0 or more of MOVE_TASK_WITH_HOME.
bool gaia::core::PageManager::removeTask ( int32_t  taskId,
int32_t  flags 
)

Completely remove the given task.

Parameters:
taskIdIdentifier of the task to be removed.
flagsAdditional operational flags. May be 0 or REMOVE_TASK_KILL_PROCESS.
Returns:
Returns true if the given task was found and removed.

Member Data Documentation

const int32_t gaia::core::PageManager::MOVE_TASK_NO_USER_ACTION = 0x00000002 [static]

Flag for moveTaskToFront(int, int): don't count this as a user-instigated action, so the current activity will not receive a hint that the user is leaving.
